speaker: Skyline
text: Fireworks explode.  **CROCK TALES** _Scene One -- Frasier's Apartment -- Kitchen -- PRESENT DAY Frasier is cooking a full-course dinner on the stove, stirring something with one hand and talking on his cordless phone with the other._ _

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I had a great time today too, Charlotte.  Oh nothing, really.  I'm having the folks over for dinner.  Just the family, and Roz.  Well, I've done it a thousand times before. Okay, I'll, uh, see you tomorrow.  Bye. _He hangs up the phone and reaches for a small, reddish earthenware vessel on the counter, which is holding his kitchen spoons and a spatula.  He picks it up by its rim, which breaks off in his hand. He sighs and gathers up the spoons and the pieces._

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake... this thing breaks like crockwork. [_laughs to himself_] Crockwork, I'll tell you... ah Frasier, once again you've suffered the tragedy of being clever, and alone. _He prepares to toss the pieces into the garbage, then stops, looking thoughtful.  The camera zooms in on the crock in his hand...  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Two - Living Room And fades in on the crock on the dinner table, as Martin is patching it up with glue.  SUPRA: "2003"  Frasier comes out of the kitchen with wine glasses.  He begins to set the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh for God's sake, Dad, would you please throw that thing away?

speaker: Martin
text: Why, what for?  When I get through gluing it, it'll be as good as new.

speaker: Frasier
text: It wasn't any good when it was new!  It's just an ugly, worthless pot.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi! [_kisses her cheek and hugs her_] How was the honeymoon?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Tahiti was absolute paradise -- except for poor Niles getting sunburned. _Niles staggers in.  His face is beet red, and - judging by his ginger movements - so is the rest of him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, Niles.  You look like you've crawled out of a bisque.

speaker: Niles
text: And you look like someone who doesn't want his Paul Gauguin souvenir oven mitt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you remembered.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey guys, welcome back!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh hello, Martin.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're a bit dressed up for a family dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, Roz is dropping by with someone she wanted me to meet.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, a lady friend?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, we're going to form a jazz trio, Niles.  Of course it's a lady friend, you cherry-faced fool.

speaker: Martin
text: So you want us to clear out?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, you don't have to do that.  If I don't like her, Roz will just take her away.  We've agreed upon a safety word: _enchant e_.  If circumstances should dictate, all I have to do is say it, and Roz will know that I'm not interested.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, would you mind getting that?  That's probably Roz. Uh, I'm just going to get rid of Dad's arts and crafts project here, all right? _Frasier gathers the crock and Martin's supplies and goes back to the kitchen.  Niles opens the door to Roz and her friend, Lisbeth._

speaker: Niles
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh hi - hey, you guys are back!  Hey, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: This is my friend Lisbeth.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Hiya. _She shakes Niles' hand, then draws back as he winces in pain.  He waves it off and ushers the two women in.  They sit on the couch._ [_N.B. During the creation of the show eleven years ago, the writers originally conceived of Martin's home health care worker being a sassy Hispanic, with Rosie Perez in mind for the role; Jane Leeves was cast only after they changed their minds and made the character an Englishwoman.  Perez's appearance here is perhaps a nod to that forgotten idea._]  [_N.B.B. Perez also voiced the guest caller Francesca in[[2.12]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_12/roz_in_the_doghouse.html "Roz In The Doghouse"), "Roz in the Doghouse."_]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, come in, this is Daphne and Martin, and, yes... can I get you a glass of wine?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, please! [_to her_] Frasier has the greatest wine.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Oh, sounds good to me.  Life's too short to drink bad wine, right?

speaker: Niles
text: [_pleased_] Amen to that!

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Just a half a glass, with club soda. [_to Roz_] You know how I love my spritzer. _Niles turns toward the kitchen.  If he could say "enchant e" for Frasier, he would. _

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: What...? [_feigning surprise_] Oh, hi!  Roz, what a pleasant surprise.

speaker: Roz
text: This is Lisbeth.  We were just shopping in the neighborhood, and thought we'd stop by.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how lovely. [_shakes her hand_] It's a pleasure to meet you, Elizabeth.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: It's not Elizabeth, it's "Lisbeth."

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, like Lisbon!

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Like a what?

speaker: Frasier
text: _Enchant e_. [_glances at Roz_]

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Right, and meeting you was just... super. _She also glances at Roz, who looks guilty as Frasier glares at her. They still haven't dropped their hands._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, the feeling is mutual. [_at Roz_] _Enchant e, enchante, enchante._

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Oh, and for me it's just been super. [_at Roz_] Super, super!

speaker: Roz
text: I took a shot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess we can stop shaking hands now.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Oh well, I'm ready whenever you are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then just let go.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: I did, you're holding on to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: What...?  Oh, dear.  Dad, what kind of glue were you using on that pot?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sighs_] Super.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: How could you be so stupid as to glue us together?! [_to Roz_] I thought you said he was smart!

speaker: Niles
text: Don't panic, I-I seem to recall that-that Superglue can be dissolved with acetone -- you know, nail polish remover.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's the smart one.  How did you know that?

speaker: Niles
text: I knew that from, uh... from school.

speaker: Frasier
text: School lunches!  The Kriezel brothers used to glue a cafeteria tray to his tie.  [_N.B. He would also know from[[2.21]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_21/an_affair_to_forget.html "An Affair To Forget"), "An Affair to Forget," when Daphne unstuck a piece of a model ship from his hand._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I suppose we'd better get some.  Let's go to the drug store.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: Drug store?  Oh, I gotta go.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, they'll be back in ten minutes.

speaker: Lisbeth
text: No, no, no, I gotta _go_.  I started the new juice diet, and I got sixty-four ounces of cran-raspberry looking for a new home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake.  All right, I'll tell you what, uh, just, uh, here, just come right in here, there you are... _Martin and Roz watch, fascinated but disturbed, as Frasier opens the powder room door and maneuvers Lisbeth inside, keeping his back turned to her._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, just a moment, uh... _He closes the door with his face wedged between it and the jam, with his arm behind him and keeping his gaze fixed on the living room._

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you there?

speaker: Lisbeth
text: [_from inside_] Almost. _Frasier slides his face down the doorjamb, hunching over to let Lisbeth move._

speaker: Lisbeth
text: That's close enough.  Could you maybe put on some music?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, could you put on some music, please?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure.  Uh, what do want, pop, big band-?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, just turn the damn thing on! _Martin does.  FADE OUT_ [_N.B. This scene would have taken place sometime after Niles and Daphne's marriage at the beginning of Season Ten, with[[11.01]](/frasier/transcripts/season_11/episode_1/no_sex_please_were_skittish.html "No Sex Please, We're Skittish"), "The Ring Cycle." However, that would have been in 2002, so apparently they didn't take their honeymoon until much later._] _Scene Three - Living Room It is evening.  Frasier opens the door to Roz.  SUPRA: "2002"_ [_N.B. Roz's attire, a leather skirt and high boots, suggests her "post- Alice" phase, when her social life had slowed down considerably but she wasn't ready to acknowledge it._]

speaker: Roz
text: Sorry I'm late.  The Cinco de Mayo traffic was _muy malo_.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, that's right, they closed some streets for the fireworks display.  Well, happy birthday, Roz.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, happy birthday.

speaker: Roz
text: Whatever. [_sinks onto the couch_] Used to be I'd go out and get a little wild on my birthday.  Now I go out and get a little dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's nothing wrong with dinner.

speaker: Roz
text: I know, but it used to come with sex.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come on, Roz, sounds like you need a drink.

speaker: Roz
text: [_wistful_] Oh, that used to come with sex, too.

speaker: Martin
text: Sounds like we got another passenger on the S.S. _Ain't Getting Any._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Wonderful day, marvelous day, you two look grand, where's Daphne?

speaker: Martin
text: Who shoved a bluebird into you?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know the S.S. _Ain't Getting Any_?  Man overboard.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shocked_] You and Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: Last night, Daphne and I engaged in sweet carnal delights.

speaker: Martin
text: [_uneasy_] Did you say "carnal" or "caramel"?

speaker: Martin
text: I'd better go wrap Roz's birthday gift. [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  I forgot about Roz's birthday.  You don't have anything I could give her, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's look, maybe one of these books... [_straightens up_] For God's sake, Niles!  I mean, how could you forget her birthday?  It's the whole reason we're having dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, forgive me, I've been a little distracted lately. Especially last night!  And again this morning. [_then_] Oh, dear God, if Daphne knew I was speaking so indiscreetly, she'd be mortified. _SMASH CUT TO: Kitchen Daphne is regaling a bewildered Roz with her own boudoir stories. Both women have wine._

speaker: Daphne
text: ...and just when I thought I'd worn him out, he flips me over like a griddle cake, and off we go again!

speaker: Roz
text: Niles?

speaker: Daphne
text: I couldn't catch me breath, it was like a marathon!  I tell you, he's spoilt me for any other man.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier's brother Niles?

speaker: Daphne
text: And guess how he woke me up this morning? [_giggles_]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, shut up already! _Reset to: Living Room The ladies come out of the kitchen as Martin enters with a gift box. Niles has something in a gift bag now._

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, birthday girl, come on over here and open some gifts.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you two, let's pay attention.  This is Roz's birthday.  This gift is from Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Happy birthday, Roz. _As Roz opens the bag and unwraps what's inside, Niles and Daphne keep grinning at each other.  Roz reveals -- the crock. _

speaker: Roz
text: It's a crock.  With a chipped lid. [_lifts the lid and looks inside_] And a dead bee.  Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_his mind completely elsewhere_] Glad you like it.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_her mind in the same place_] Oh, you know, I-I think I left your present in my room.  Niles, will you help me with it?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, of course.

speaker: Niles
text: We'll be back very quickie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Quickly!

speaker: Niles
text: Quickly.

speaker: Martin
text: You don't think they're gonna...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I have no idea.  Try not to think about it. _They stand around uncomfortably.  Then behind them, the skyline lights up as fireworks explode all over._

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, he really is good.  [_N.B. 2002 means the second half of Season Nine and the first half of Season Ten -- although the goofy smile that Niles wears for most of this scene is much like the one he wore after he and Daphne first slept together in [[8.19]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_19/daphne_returns.html "Daphne Returns"), "Daphne Returns."_]  [_N.B.B. This gag is also an obvious tribute to Hitchcock's "To Catch A Thief," in which the male and female leads fall onto a couch, kissing, and the camera shifts up to show fireworks going off._] _FADE TO:  Scene Four -- Living Room It is mid-morning.  Martin is watching a baseball game on TV.  SUPRA: "1999"  Frasier comes out dressed as Uncle Sam: bright red-white-and-blue pantaloons, jacket and top hat, and a silvery wig and goatee - even his eyebrows are silver and bushy.  He picks up a pair of remote headphones off the credenza. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I bought you these headphones, so that I wouldn't be subjected to your sports drivel.  Please put them on.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, I will.  But only if you say it. _Frasier sighs and points his finger like the old World War II recruiting poster._

speaker: Frasier
text: I WANT _YOU_ -- to wear those headphones!

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know why you care, you're just going to be out riding on that stupid parade float.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s., from the kitchen_] The KACL Fourth of July float is not stupid! [_comes out_] Unless you think it is stupid to commemorate a hardy band of revolutionaries, their minds ablaze with...

speaker: Martin
text: [_puts on the headphones_] Hey, you're right, this does cut out all the drivel! _Daphne comes out, wearing a comically mismatched outfit: patchwork pants, a white striped shirt, and a powder-blue suit jacket._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hey, Daph.  My God, you look hideous.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.  Now I wouldn't normally wear polyester on the hottest day of the year, but some English friends of mine are having an Ugly American party in honor of the Fourth. _The doorbell rings.  As Frasier goes to answer it, Daphne drops into the drag-queen American accent that she used in[[4.19]](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_19/three_dates_and_a_break_up_1.html "Three Dates And A Break Up \[1\]"), "Three Dates and a Breakup[1]." _

speaker: Daphne
text: We're gonna toss back a couple a' cold brewskis, watch the ball game, and not use the metric system.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing_] That's very funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Uncle Sam.  Didn't you just hand me a flyer for a mattress sale?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, listen, Roz is running a little late, so we're just gonna meet her downstairs, all right?  Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_waving goodbye_] We're off!  See you later!

speaker: Martin
text: [_takes off the headphones_] Oh, okay, good luck!  Boy, these are great.  Now I can watch TV without bugging anybody.

speaker: Martin
text: [_suddenly singing, loudly_] My bacon, is Farmer Frank's bacon! There's no mistakin', the quality... _Frasier and Niles shrug, then Frasier's glance drifts to the red-white-and- blue drapes on his balcony._

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait a minute.  Is my bunting a-droop?  It's supposed to drape evenly -- oh, for God's sakes.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_groans_] You're not going to send me back to the Space Needle with binoculars and a walkie-talkie again, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, there's no time for that.  We can fix it on the fly. It'll just take a second. _Reset to: Balcony He leads Niles and Daphne out to the balcony._

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, Niles, grab that end. _Daphne closes the door behind them -- and the handle comes off in her hand. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Excuse me?  This shouldn't come off like this, should it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  Um... here. [_tries the other door; it's also locked_] Oh, lord. _Reset to: Living Room Martin comes back into the living room with a bowl of chips.  He doesn't hear or see Frasier, Niles, and Daphne waving frantically and yelling "Dad!" "Mr. Crane!" etc.  He puts them down on the side table and goes back into the kitchen.  Reset to: Balcony_

speaker: Niles
text: He can't hear us.  We're stuck out here, what are we gonna do?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, let's not panic.  You know what, maybe some of our neighbors are out on their balconies, we'll just call out to them. _They start yelling to the balconies above and below them.  Reset to: Living Room Roz comes in the front door wearing a red-and-white polka-dotted Betsy Ross costume._

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  Hello? _She looks out and sees the three of them on the balcony, waving and yelling excitedly.  She also hears the roar of jet engines outside._

speaker: Roz
text: The Blue Angels! _Reset to: Balcony She runs out onto the balcony.  The scream of a passing jet drowns out the sound of the door being opened, and fades just in time to let them hear it close again._

speaker: Roz
text: Wow! _As Roz looks eagerly skyward, the other three look at her, then at the door, then at her again._

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: Locked-Out! _Reset to: Living Room Martin comes back in with the crock, which he sets next to the chips. Now all four of them are yelling and waving, with Roz adding "Martin!" to "Dad!" and "Mr. Crane!" Again, he doesn't notice and sits in his chair to watch the game._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, how long does a baseball match last?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, usually three hours, but...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear. _Niles groans and sits in one of the deck chairs as the other three stand in front of him at the balcony._

speaker: Roz
text: This sucks, I don't even have my cell phone.  Don't you have your cell phone, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'm Uncle Sam, I don't have a cell phone.  I shouldn't even have this zipper.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's going to be a hundred degrees out here, I'm roasting in these things! _Niles, who has been searching his pockets, finds his cell phone. He excitedly steps forward, holding it up-_

speaker: Daphne
text: That's it, these clothes are coming off. _-and quickly buries it in his jacket as Daphne sheds her jacket, drops her belt, and starts to unbutton her shirt._ [_N.B. 1999 means the second half of Season Six, and the first half of Season Seven.  Daphne's pageboy haircut indicates that this is Season Six -- although it should be noted that when they are yelling at Frasier's neighbors, she yells "Mr. Winston, are you home?"  Cam Winston was not referred to until Season Seven, but might well have moved into Frasier's building long before._] _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Five -- Living Room Evening.  Frasier and Niles are on the couch, and Frasier pours Niles a glass of wine.  Niles is very depressed, and more than a little drunk.  SUPRA: "1998"  The phone rings, and Niles starts to get up. _

speaker: Frasier
text: That's all right, Niles, allow me. [_calls_] Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Coming! [_answers the phone_] Hello, Crane residence.  Oh hello, Mum, Happy Thanksgiving.  Yeah, it's the holiday where everyone eats turkey.  No, we're having goose.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, when you're finished with that, could you please bring us some snacks to soak up this wine?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and a little more wine.  Who knew my sorrows would be such strong swimmers?

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't talk right now, Mum.  Dr. Crane has guests.  Yeah, he's still out of work. _Reset to: Kitchen Daphne comes in and lays out some snacks and another bottle of wine. The crock is sitting on the snack tray._

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course I'm worried he might let me go.  I worry about it every day.  But I'm coping. _She drains her own glass of wine.  Reset to: Living Room Roz comes out with a baby bag._

speaker: Roz
text: Alice is so cute.  She fell asleep hugging her bottle.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm right behind her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, will you please stop being so morose?  It is Thanksgiving.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you're right!  I should count my blessings: I'm in the midst of a bitter divorce; Maris is freezing my assets, forcing me to live in the Shangri-La, which is the devil's own apartment complex -- where last night they turned off my heat, re-freezing my assets!

speaker: Frasier
text: We're all going through a bit of a rough patch.  Look at Roz and me, we're out of a job.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, not me.  I just took a phone temp job in customer service. I can work from wherever I am, they just patch the calls through.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, now you see?  There's a positive attitude!

speaker: Frasier
text: Some people see losing a job as an opportunity! [_Daphne brings the snacks_] Oh, thank you. _Daphne retreats into the kitchen, looking worried.  Roz's cell phone rings._

speaker: Roz
text: Hello? [_sexy voice_] Oh, hello.  Yes, this is Monique.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm just lying in the tub, soaping myself all over...

speaker: Frasier
text: Good heavens, Roz!  Is that the sort of customer you're servicing?!  Hang that up!

speaker: Roz
text: Call me later, Tiger, okay? [_hangs up; normal voice_] What? It pays the bills, and I'm not tied to a desk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not unless they ask you to be!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, good news, the Cowboys just scored.  Bad news is, I kinda screamed and woke somebody's baby up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Daphne, my bath salts man has just delivered a new shipment of my proprietary blend -- could you please run me a tub tonight?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sweetly_] Oh, of course I will, Dr. Crane. [_comes and refills their wine glasses_] What would you do without me? [_to Niles_] A little more?

speaker: Daphne
text: I know things have been tough lately, but they'll turn around for you. [_caresses his cheek_] Just watch. _She goes to the kitchen again.  Niles, dumbstruck, feels his cheek as if blessed._

speaker: Niles
text: She's an angel.  You're right, Frasier.  I'm being too morose. I'm not taking action. [_gets up_] I'm telling Daphne I love her, tonight!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grabs him_] Niles, let's not be rash.  Come on, come on, let's get you some fresh air.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't want air, I want Daphne! _Frasier pulls him out to the balcony.  Roz's cell phone rings.  Martin looks around, sees he is alone, and gets up to answer it._

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, thank you, you've got a nice, deep voice too. [_looks more confused_] Uh -- oh, I don't know. [_looks down_] Uh, brown pants and a plaid shirt - Hello?  Hello? _He shrugs and hangs up.  Roz comes out and sees Niles yelling and gesturing wildly at Frasier._

speaker: Roz
text: Is everything all right?  What's wrong with Niles?

speaker: Martin
text: He decided that today's the day he's going to tell Daphne.

speaker: Roz
text: He's gonna tell Daphne with all of us here?  That's gonna be uncomfortable.

speaker: Martin
text: I know, but I guess he figures he just can't afford to wait any longer.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Niles -- [_Niles breaks away_] Niles, Niles, please!

speaker: Niles
text: [_passionately_] Daphne...!

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, I know what you're going to do!

speaker: Niles
text: You do?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Not you, Dr. Crane -- Dr. Crane!  And you can't fire me, because I quit!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: After all I've done to save you money!  I'm washing my face with dish soap while you're out buying imported bath salts like a big rich girl!  _I hope you rot in debtors' prison!_ [_N.B. GREAT delivery by Jane Leeves on that last line._]

speaker: Niles
text: She's an angel!  [_N.B. The year 1998, and the specific circumstances referred to fix this episode at somewhere just after[[6.07]](/frasier/transcripts/season_6/episode_7/how_to_bury_a_millionaire.html "How To Bury A Millionaire"), "How to Bury a Millionaire," when Niles was at a low point.  Also, a slight discontinuity here -- Roz was not aware of Niles' feelings for Daphne until [[6.16]](/frasier/transcripts/season_6/episode_16/decoys.html "Decoys") "Decoys," much later in Season Six, after she and Frasier had gotten their jobs back._] _FADE TO:  Scene Six -- Living Room Morning.  Frasier sees a woman to the elevator.  SUPRA: "1996" _

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll pick you up at seven, my angel. _He turns around with a moonstruck smile.  Daphne and Martin are seated at the dining table._

speaker: Frasier
text: You'd better get used to the name "Evelyn Griebel," because you're going to be hearing an awful lot of it around here. Evelyn Griebel -- sounds like music, doesn't it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Haven't you only been dating her a week?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well yes, and you know how loath I am to use the expression "she may be the one," but I think in this case it's appropriate. _Both Daphne and Martin have a weary look on their faces -- they know he's setting himself up for a fall, and know how useless it is to try and tell him.  Niles comes out of the hallway in a huff. _

speaker: Niles
text: I finally got Maris calmed down.  I hope you're happy.

speaker: Frasier
text: All I said was, "Maris, why the long face?"

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and now she's on the phone to her chin-grinder in Zurich.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I'll get that.  It's probably Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well?

speaker: Roz
text: Sorry I'm late, but I had a date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I thought that was last night.

speaker: Roz
text: It was a good date.  How's your new girlfriend?

speaker: Frasier
text: I allowed her to climb to the first base camp on Mount Crane and I believe she's feeling the effects of the altitude. [_laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: Is one of them nausea?  Cause I'm getting that right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, shut up!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you hungry, Roz?  There's cheese here.  Oh, nobody opened it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, Dad, that's three years old!  Throw it out!

speaker: Martin
text: No, it'll be fine.  Sure you don't want any?  The label says it's "famously spreadable."

speaker: Niles
text: Funny, Roz, doesn't your label say the same thing?

speaker: Roz
text: What does yours say, Niles -- "may cause drowsiness"?  I'm just having some fun, �cause I know I'll be settling down someday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, thank God my dating days are over!  Three years on the Seattle singles scene is quite enough, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Oh hi, Evelyn. [_puts the phone to his shoulder_] She can't go five minutes without talking to me. [_into phone_] Listen, I'm really looking forward to dinner tomorrow... I see.  Well, if tomorrow's no good... I see. _Roz, Niles, Daphne, and Martin are all trading looks, daring each other to act surprised._

speaker: Frasier
text: But you said you were having such a lovely time... I see. Perhaps I'd better take this in my room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what are you smirking at?!  [_N.B. The year 1996, and the fact that Niles is still with Maris, fix this episode at somewhere in the Third Season before[[3.08]](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_8/the_last_time_i_saw_maris.html "The Last Time I Saw Maris"), "The Last Time I Saw Maris," when Niles and Maris separated._] _FADE TO:  Scene Seven - Living Room Evening.  Frasier is reading a book on the couch.  Eddie is sitting up next to him, staring at him.  SUPRA: "1993"_

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you staring at? "The Good Son." _

speaker: Martin
text: It's fourteen.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: You're reading about Jack Russell terriers, right?  That's how many years they live -- fourteen. _Frasier sheepishly closes the book.  The doorbell rings.  Frasier gets up and answers it to Niles, with a shopping bag._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, there are the merry bachelors in their swinging new pad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Where's Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, she's taken to her bed.  This large-earring fad has compressed her spine.  Where is your, uh, enchanting new home healthcare worker? _Daphne comes out, wearing the short sundress-and-stockings ensemble and piled-up hairstyle she made famous in the first season._

speaker: Daphne
text: I just found out what that second toilet in me loo is for! [_laughs_] Talk about a shock!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello there.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  You're, uh... oh, don't tell me, I'm good with names. Uh... Miles Crane!

speaker: Niles
text: ...Yes, I am!  And-and you're Daphne Moon, from Manchester, where you developed a liking for Nickerson's Lemon Biscuits.

speaker: Daphne
text: What a kind man you are, Miles Crane. _She takes the biscuits and turns away.  Niles grimaces in disappointment._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh by the way, I've invited Roz Doyle to join us -- she's my producer over at the radio station.  She had no plans this evening -- you know, I think the poor thing has a hard time meeting men.

speaker: Niles
text: Hm.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_heads to the bar_] Anyway, would you care for a scotch, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh yes -- actually, I'm in a sherry mood tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sherry?  What an intriguing idea.  Think I could scare up a bottle of sherry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'll get it. _She answers it to Roz.  Frasier comes out of the kitchen removing the cork from a bottle of sherry._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, Roz, come on in.  Uh, I'd like you to meet my dad. This is Martin Crane, and his home healthcare worker, Daphne Moon, and of course this is my brother, Niles Crane.  [_N.B. Another slight discontinuity - this is Season One, but Roz and Martin actually first met in[[1.06]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_6/the_crucible.html "The Crucible"), "The Crucible" -- which was also the first time she saw Frasier's apartment._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh my God, is it Niles?  Oh, I feel so embarrassed.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh no, please, don't be.  Actually, I prefer Miles. _As he says this, he casually leans back against the cabinet - knocking over the books on top and nearly falling after them himself.  Daphne bends over to pick them up, and her bum stretches against her dress, mesmerizing Niles.  When she straightens up, he fixes his gaze on the ceiling.  The doorbell rings again._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that'll be my pizza.  Could you get it?

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  You are not having pizza.  I made a duck.

speaker: Martin
text: What, you're gonna tell me what I can eat now?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm just saying that it's rude to bring your own food to a dinner party. _Martin goes to the kitchen as Frasier opens the door to the pizza delivery boy -- Kenny, wearing a denim jacket and with long, shaggy black hair. _

speaker: Kenny
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello.

speaker: Kenny
text: Twelve bucks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, aren't you that new radio shrink at KACL -- Dr. Frasier Crane, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes I am.  It's always nice to meet a fan.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well actually, I'm in the radio game myself.  This pizza thing is just paying the bills until a job opens up.  Maybe you could put a good word in for me down at the- _Frasier mumbles "thank you" and shuts the door in Kenny's face. He carries the pizza to the dining table as Martin comes out with the crock._

speaker: Roz
text: Pizza smells good.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, have some.  It's called a Dirty Dozen.  Twelve delicious toppings, and not one of them duck.

speaker: Frasier
text: This from the gourmet who dumped my Cornish Yarg cheese down the disposal.

speaker: Martin
text: It was covered with mold!

speaker: Frasier
text: It was supposed to be!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I said I'd replace it, didn't I?  And here it is, I hope you're happy. _He places the crock on the table.  Frasier picks it up and reads the label._

speaker: Frasier
text: "With pasteurized, processed, cheese-flavored snack food." [_looks inside_] Dear God, it looks like someone melted down a highway cone.

speaker: Martin
text: Just trying to be nice, you don't need to be a jerk about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, Dad, I'm sorry, thank you. [_to Niles_] Would you please join me in the kitchen...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Miles! _Reset to: Kitchen Niles follows Frasier in.  Frasier is carrying the crock._

speaker: Frasier
text: He is driving me batty!  All right, we are making a deal. He spends six months here, and then he's moving into your house.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely, we'll switch off.

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s._] Someone bring me a beer?

speaker: Roz
text: [_o.s._] Yeah, beer sounds good.

speaker: Frasier
text: I should have just gotten a keg.  I tell you something, this is the last time I try to make a nice dinner for these people! _He picks up the crock and reads the label again.  The camera zooms in on it...  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Eight -- Present Day Back to where we left off.  Frasier smiles, closes the garbage, then fits the broken piece back onto the crock, goes out and places it in the center of the table. _ [_N.B. "Of course I'm respectable, I'm old.  Whores, ugly buildings and politicians all become respectable if they last long enough." -- John Huston in "Chinatown."_] _The doorbell rings.  Frasier walks to the door, passing Martin coming from the hallway._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hey Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dinner's ready.

speaker: Martin
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, you guys, come on in. _He hugs and kisses his family and friends, as they all ad-lib greetings.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT TWO_
